com.vikwin.functcp.server

Class FunctionalTCPServer<Request,Reply>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vikwin.functcp.server.FunctionalTCPServer<Request,Reply>
  • Type Parameters:
    Request - Type of Request object
    Reply - Type of Reply object

    public class FunctionalTCPServer<Request,Reply>
extends java.lang.Object
    FunctionalTCPServer is a generic, multithreaded, message-based TCP Server. It expects messages (Request objects) of any type from a client, passes it to a user defined function, and optionally sends back a reply of any type (Reply object). The corresponding client is FunctionalTCPClient.
    Author:
    Viktor Winkelmann

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FunctionalTCPServer(java.util.function.Function<Request,Reply> inputHandler, int port)
      Creates an instance of the Functional TCP Server on a given port.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FunctionalTCPServer

        public FunctionalTCPServer(java.util.function.Function<Request,Reply> inputHandler,
                           int port)
        Creates an instance of the Functional TCP Server on a given port. If port is set to 0, it will start on a random free port. It can be retrieved afterwards using getPort(). The instance has to be started using start() after instantiation.
        Parameters:
        inputHandler - A handler function that processes message objects reveived from clients.
        port - A port number to listen on (0-65535)

    • Method Detail

      • getWorkerCount

        public int getWorkerCount()
        Returns the maximum count of threads the server will be using.
        Returns:
        Maximum workerthread count

      • setWorkerCount

        public void setWorkerCount(int count)
        Sets the maximum count of threads the server will be using.
        Parameters:
        count - Maximum workerthread count

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the currently set port. Note: If the server was instantiated with port set to 0, this method will return 0 until the server is started.
        Returns:
        Port the server listens on

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Checks if the server main thread is running.
        Returns:
        true if running, else false

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the server in it's own thread. This is an asynchronous (non-blocking) call.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Shuts the server down if it is running. This is a synchronous (blocking) call.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown if current thread get's interrupted
